articles.headline: With Schoolgirls Taken by Boko Haram Still Missing, U.S.-Nigeria Ties Falter
articles.snippet: Distrust between the two countries has resurfaced as the search for nearly 300 kidnapped girls has lost momentum.
articles.abstract: Distrust between the two countries has resurfaced as the search for nearly 300 kidnapped girls has lost momentum.
articles.lead_paragraph: STUTTGART, Germany — Soon after the Islamist group Boko Haram kidnapped nearly 300 teenage girls in Nigeria in April, the United States sent surveillance drones and about 30 intelligence and security experts to help the Nigerian military try to rescue them. Gen. David M. Rodriguez, the top general for American missions in Africa, rushed from his headquarters here to help the commanders in the crisis.

articles.headline: States’ Minimum Wages Rise, Helping Millions of Workers
articles.snippet: Minimum wage increases go into effect in 20 states and the District of Columbia by Jan. 1, and, all told, 29 states will exceed the federal minimum of $7.25 an hour at the beginning of January.
articles.abstract: Minimum wage increases go into effect in 20 states and the District of Columbia by Jan. 1, and, all told, 29 states will exceed the federal minimum of $7.25 an hour at the beginning of January.
articles.lead_paragraph: For some low-wage workers, everyday tasks like spending money for bus fare to get to and from work also involve deciding which bill to pay or delay, or what to give up.

articles.headline: Mission Ends in Afghanistan, but Sacrifices Are Not Over for U.S. Soldiers
articles.snippet: As United States combat operations formally ended, many military families said they sensed they had already been forgotten.
articles.abstract: As United States combat operations formally ended, many military families said they sensed they had already been forgotten.
articles.lead_paragraph: KILLEEN, Tex. — Sgt. First Class Ramon Morris, a muscular dynamo and a father on his fifth deployment, was killed Dec. 12 in a roadside bombing in Afghanistan.

articles.headline: Carmakers Take a Hint From Tablets
articles.snippet: By adopting tabletlike, touch-screen systems, automakers are integrating smartphones and online services with fewer complicated controls that frustrate and distract drivers.
articles.abstract: By adopting tabletlike, touch-screen systems, automakers are integrating smartphones and online services with fewer complicated controls that frustrate and distract drivers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Reaching an apogee of confusion, car dashboards have become a bewildering array of screens, buttons and knobs to control functions like the radio, ventilation, advanced safety systems and Internet services.

articles.headline: In Moments, New Year’s Revelry Became Fatal Crush in Shanghai
articles.snippet: Most of the 36 victims were young revelers who had come to ring in 2015 on the Bund, the city’s iconic riverfront promenade.
articles.abstract: Most of the 36 victims were young revelers who had come to ring in 2015 on the Bund, the city’s iconic riverfront promenade.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — With a dazzling light show set to begin at midnight, a huge crowd of revelers had gathered for an outdoor New Year’s Eve in this city’s historic riverfront district. They began to grow unruly.
